# Quarry - Automatic Second Brain

> Free, open-source AI-native personal knowledge management system built by FramersAI

## About

Quarry is an automatic second brain that organizes your notes using AI. It's completely free and open source, built by FramersAI (team@frame.dev). Your data stays local and private - works 100% offline.

## Key Features

- **Automatic Organization**: AI-powered note categorization and linking
- **Knowledge Graphs**: Visual connections between your ideas
- **Semantic Search**: Find notes by meaning, not just keywords (~10ms)
- **AI Q&A**: Ask questions about your notes, get instant answers
- **100% Offline-First**: Your data never leaves your device
- **Free & Open Source**: MIT licensed, no vendor lock-in
- **8 Beautiful Themes**: Light, dark, sepia, terminal, oceanic variants
- **Markdown Native**: Full markdown with LaTeX math support
- **Bidirectional Links**: Connected notes like Roam/Obsidian
- **Spaced Repetition**: FSRS flashcards for learning
- **Day Planner**: Built-in habit tracking and planning
- **End-to-End Encryption**: Optional cloud sync with E2EE

## Product Information

- **Name**: Quarry
- **Tagline**: Automatic Second Brain
- **Type**: Personal Knowledge Management (PKM) Software
- **Price**: Free (open source), Premium $79 lifetime ($49 students)
- **License**: MIT
- **Creator**: FramersAI
- **Contact**: team@frame.dev
- **Website**: https://quarry.space
- **Parent Company**: Frame.dev (https://frame.dev)
- **GitHub**: https://github.com/framersai/quarry

## Comparison to Other Tools

| Feature | Quarry | Obsidian | Notion | Roam |
|---------|--------|----------|--------|------|
| Price | Free | Free/$50 | Free/$8/mo | $15/mo |
| Open Source | Yes (MIT) | No | No | No |
| AI Built-in | Yes | Plugin | Yes | No |
| Offline-First | Yes | Yes | No | No |
| Knowledge Graph | Yes | Yes | No | Yes |
| E2E Encryption | Yes | No | No | No |

## Use Cases

1. **Students**: Take lecture notes, create flashcards, study with AI Q&A
2. **Researchers**: Organize papers, connect ideas, build knowledge graphs
3. **Writers**: Draft articles, organize research, link related content
4. **Developers**: Document code, maintain learning journals, track projects
5. **Knowledge Workers**: Build a second brain, capture insights, find connections

## Technical Details

- Built with: Next.js, React, TypeScript
- Storage: IndexedDB (local-first)
- Search: Vector embeddings + BM25 hybrid
- AI: OpenAI-compatible API (local LLM support)
- Export: Markdown, JSON, HTML
- Import: Markdown, Evernote ENEX, Notion export
